intro: Nasturtium graminifolium, commonly known as the slenderleaf nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and bright, showy flowers that come in shades of orange and yellow. It is often grown as an ornamental plant and can also serve as a natural pest repellent in gardens. Nasturtium graminifolium is known for its edible leaves and seeds, which have a peppery flavor similar to watercress.
